properties.name: Davies Drop in Start and Water Drop

description:
Davies is a remote wilderness canyon, usually done as an overnight trip.

As at 2024 the canyon is rigged largely with slings.

Some sections of Davies can be enclosed. Be aware of water levels. The catchment is 17.5 km².

Refer to Kanangra_Main regarding gauges and flow rates.

Approach

Use the GPX from Thurat_Rift to navigate across Thurat Tops.

Park on the Kanangra Walls road at the start of the King Pin firetrail. Follow the firetrail to Mt Thurat, then walk across Thurat Tops to Thurat Ridge as far as -33.93083, 150.11219. Drop water for the exit walk. Descend down to Sally Camp Creek, entering the creek at about -33.92593, 150.10996 (no lower downstream).

Descent

Number Where Length (metres) Notes
1a River right 28 Right of falls on rocky point from exposed nose of rock off slings
1b River right 26 Immediately after 1a. Sling on tree. Can do 1a & 1b as one drop.
Creek Walk 250m
2 River right 50 Tree. Beside waterfall
3a River right 28 Anchor is on a tree, sling at head height, just before cascades, away from river, through bushes. Abseil down a shallow slot. Can scramble/slip/slide; rather abseil.
3b River right 20 Walk around to the right from 3a, look for slings at base of bushy tree. Into river. High water danger from here.
Short swims and river walk. Difficult climb-down RL
4 River left 15 Sling river centre underneath boulder, possibly also slings under 1m high cascade RL, 3m back from waterfall.
Creek walking
5 River right 10 At falls, in trees off slings
6 River left 20 At cascades over a series of slabs into pool, clamber RL down through trees to slings off tree. Can combine 5 & 6, 32m
7 River left 20 After slabs, at top of waterfall, RL in trees, slings.
8 River left 55 Directly after 7, slings off tree. Abseil beside waterfall into pool
Creek drops into slot without anchors, scramble RL on dirt and traverse for quite a way,
9 River left 10 At -33.91117, 150.12259 abseil down. Rejoin river
10 River right 4
~250m to Whalania Creek junction


Also useful to refer to GPS waypoints (click map top of page)

After the confluence with Whalania Creek, find a campsite somewhere around -33.907044,150.124106

Exit

  • From campsite proceed up ridge to Mt Paralyser summit
  • As at summer 22/23 the slopes are heavily overgrown from about 650m elevation to summit
  • From Mt Paralyser summit walk along ridge line back to entry route

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

  • YouTube.com : Richard Pattison, Davies Canyon movie
